intro: Pavetta peninsularis, commonly known as the Peninsular Pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
